Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: So, uh... you found a band for your wedding yet?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: 'Cause I'm in a band. We really rock.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, I mean it's inevitable. I definitely overhear some wedding preparation, but I'm fine with it. She hears me arranging my social life. And we both have to hear Dwight order deer urine over the Internet, so it evens out.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Oh I got the 'Save The Date'.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Yeah, pretty stationery.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, thanks!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I didn't get mine yet.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Uh...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: There are a few people I decided not to invite, and that might make things kind of awkward but ... it's my wedding. And I don't want anyone there who has called me a hussy.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, thanks, Fantastic Sam's. Adult Cut Plus. Comes with a shampoo and blow dry. We're doing I.D. photos today. Gotta represent.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Uh, on or off?

Quote.Speaker: I.D. Photographer
Quote.Text: Off.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Okay... [removes glasses]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh! What is on your face? Is that a disguise?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: [leaving the room] Excuse me.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Clown paint.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I.D. badges are long overdue. Security in this office park is a joke. Last year, I came to work with my spud gun in a duffel bag. I sat at my desk all day, with a rifle that shoots potatoes at 60 pounds per square inch. Can you imagine if I was deranged?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's a nice tie.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That is... who makes that?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Um, I don't...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Do you mind if I wear that for the photo?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Um... let's um, let's keep our clothes.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: It's like child abuse. I say, if Jesus saw that, he'd freak out! He'd freak out, Toby! I mean on some levels... it's... and I'm supposed to work there. I'm supposed...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [walking into the Conference room] What's the dealio?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Just letting Oscar vent a little. We would use the break room, but the photographer's back there today.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What's the problem?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Angela!

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: It's just a little dispute over a poster in their workspace.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Since Christmas.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So what, you're having a little spat. I forget, are you guys dating?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Michael, can I talk to you for a uh, second please?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Here's how I usually handle this: all I do is listen.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: These things just have a way of working themselves out.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: It's like if you write someone a letter, when you're really angry... they say to keep it in a drawer for a couple days. Then you just never end up sending it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What do you know about conflict resolution? Your answer to everything is to get divorced. So...

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay... what?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: That was the right decision for me and my marriage.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, well... that's not gonna fly here. Because in this office, it is till death do us part... assuming we don't get downsized. [leans over to Pam] Uh, Pam, will you get Angela and meet us in the conference room please?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [holding up a binder] A mediator's tool chest. Okay, well, before we get started, you should know that are 5 different styles of conflict.[in a comedic voice] My Shaolin temple style defeats your monkey style.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Can we go? I have a lot of work to do.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. Okay, this is important. The first style is lose/lose.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: What's the next one?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Just hold on, please! Okay, if we do lose/lose, neither of you gets what you want. Do you understand? You... you would both lose. Now I need to ask you, do you want to pursue a lose/lose negotiation?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Can we just skip to whatever number 5 is - win/win or whatever?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Win/Win is number four and number five is win/win/win. The important difference here is with win/win/win, we all win. Me too. I win for having successfully mediated a conflict at work.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [in front of poster] Okay, since this is the disputed poster. Now, one at a time, I want you to express your feelings using "I" emotion language and no judging or "you" statements.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I got this poster for Christmas, and I feel I want to see it everyday. It makes me feel like the babies are the true artists, and God has a really cute sense of humor.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Come on, seriously, that?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I don't like looking at it. It's creepy, and in bad taste, and it's just offensive to me. It makes me think of the horrible, frigid stage mothers who force the babies into it. It's kitsch. It's the opposite of art. It destroys art. It destroys souls. This is so much more offensive to me than hardcore porno. I'm talking about the...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, okay. Stop, stop, stop! Let's see if we can just brainstorm and find some creative alternatives that are win/win.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Win!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes. Thank you, Pam. How about Angela makes the poster into a t-shirt, which Oscar wears. That way, he can never see it and whenever she looks at Oscar, she can see it. Win/win/win.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: That's... no...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay... well, brainstorm. Own the solution.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: How about, I leave it up?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: How 'bout, she takes it down?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: How about, Angela can keep it up on Tuesdays and Thursdays?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, that is called a compromise. And it is style 3. And it is not ideal. To sum up, win/win - make the poster into a t-shirt, win/lose - take the poster down, compromise - Tuesdays and Thursdays. And the answer is... make the poster into a t-shirt! Win/win.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Win.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Fine.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: But, it...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [claps his hands twice] It is done!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Win

Quote.Speaker: Photographer
Quote.Text: [snaps a photo of Creed, then Creed turns to the side for a profile shot] No, you're all good.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Great. [gets up and leaves]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey, Angela.[hands her a Save The Date card] I didn't have your zip code.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Oh. Thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: It was hand delivered. But, I did get a Save The Date after all. It's not my taste.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: You solved it?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Well, good. We can, uh, throw that one out. [shuffles through papers]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Are those all the other complains?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Mmm-Hm.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I would like to see those please.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I... I can't do that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You can't do that, huh? Huh, ok. Now you and I have a conflict. I order you to give me that file.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: That... [shakes head and places hand over the file]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. [yanks the file away, despite Toby's resistance] There! No more conflict. [looks at the camera] I had to use win/lose on that. It was not pretty. [looks back at Toby] All right... is that it?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: [sighs and pulls out a box under his desk] It's all Dwight's.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Every Friday at 4, I have a standing appointment with Dwight for him to file a grievance against Jim. I tell him that I'm sending them to a special file in New York. That box is the special file in New York.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ohh... God. Alright. Why do I have to do everything?

Quote.Speaker: Photographer
Quote.Text: Are you sure? [looks at Oscar, who is front of the camera, holding the baby poster in front of his chest]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, he's sure. Just shoot.

Quote.Speaker: Photographer
Quote.Text: [shoots twice]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [looking through papers in the complaint box] This is from Kevin. He says Stanley uses his Miracle Whip without asking. Meredith complains that everyone talks too loud in the morning and the lights are too bright. Creed... huh. Duh, duh. Creed is sick of looking at the redhead all day and wants a seat facing the receptionist.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Nice.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You will notice that not one of these complaints is against me.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Actually, I have a separate folder for complaints against Michael. This [unlocks a drawer]is January through March of this year. [pulls out a fairly large folder]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: How many of you have at one time gone to Toby to complain about another employee? [looks at all the employees, most of whom raise their hands] And... did you get what you wanted, or were you merely listened to, you forget about your problem, and you move on? [employees mumble "merely listen to and forgotten..." ] That is outrageous! I love this place... and it pains me to see all of the negativity festering... [sighs] Okay, today we are going to get everything out of these files and into the open, where it can be resolved. Alright, how about the Phyllis/Angela dispute?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: You already did me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's what she said. [Jim mouths these words along with Michael] The thing is, Angela... you are in here an awful lot. You have complained about everybody in the office, except Dwight, which is odd because everyone else has had run ins with Dwight. Toby, by the way, what does "redacted" mean? There is a file full of complaints in here marked "redacted"... ?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Yeah, it just means whoever complained came to me later and withdrew it, so I took their name off.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, ok. There were a bunch of complaints about Dwight that were put in the redacted file about six months ago.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Whoa.. wha... wait. If someone has a problem with me, why would they withdraw it six months ago?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [notices Angela's intense concern] Um... let's move on. I volunteer. Did anyone have a problem with me?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right, Pamela. Come on down! Let's do it! And [looks through the file]... okay. Just one complaint. Actually, it has been withdrawn. So that is no help to us. Next.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Wait, what did it say?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh... [reading]"Does she have to plan her wedding on office time? Couldn't she do that at home?" [Pam looks Angela an angry look] Who else? Why don't we just warm up first? Warm up emotionally, all right?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I have this kind of big secret about Angela. And I've been really nice to her... and I haven't told anyone. And what the hell?!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Here is a Kelly complaint: "Ryan never returns my calls." Ugh, join the club.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: My voicemail's really spotty... sometimes...

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I didn't file a complaint. I was just talking.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: To your HR representative.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: To my friend, I thought. I want that withdrawn.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Fine, I'll take your name off. [looks at Michael] So no one will know.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [crumbles up the complaint paper] Makin' progress. [Jim raises his hand] Yes?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Dwight tried to kiss me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What?!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: And I didn't tell anyone because I'm not really sure how I feel about it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That is not true. Redact it. Redact it!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, I'm not actually making a formal complaint. I just really think we should talk about it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, question. [looks at Toby] When a name is withdrawn, does that also apply to the permanent misbehavior file in New York?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Sure.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Stanley. [off camera]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [gets up and walks over to Angela, whispering to her] Hey. Thanks for ratting me out!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [still of camera] You got a lot of anger under there buddy. Come on start us out. Unleash it.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I didn't do it! [Michael and Stanley continue to talk off camera, but it's inaudible]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I find that hard to believe... considering you have problems with every single person in this entire office except Bobblehead Joe.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Someone complained that the men's room is "whites only". Stanley, you know that's not true.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I didn't say that.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Then why is there a picture of a white man on the door? [Michael, along with the camera, look at the standard stick man on the bathroom door.]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, Phyllis. You complained that Angela's giving you dirty looks. And you tried to get off the party planning committee.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: No, I never said any such thing. Angela and I are close.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And... also, Phyllis, Stanley says that you cry too much, and that bugs him.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Stanley and I are close, too.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: We sit close.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh... ok.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: [sits down for his ID picture] Just take it. [flashes goes off, while he is standing back up again]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I can't believe Angela. I went against my better judgment, and I gave her a Save The Date. And now it turns out she complained about me to Toby.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, it was redacted. Look, if she wants an invite, maybe she's just trying to be friends.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Don't take her side.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [sighs] Well, what does Roy think about everything?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I don't know. I try not to bother him about this kind of stuff.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You mean your thoughts and feelings?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah...

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I know you keep saying it's your space, even though there's no assigned parking, but I keep forgetting.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Yes, that's the problem.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I guess so...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, well... all settled, then.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: [whispering to Angela] I don't like you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: OK, Ryan. You told Toby that Creed has a distinct old man smell?

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: I know exactly what he's talking about. I sprout mung beans on a damp paper towel in my desk drawer. Very nutritious. But they smell like death.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right, Kevin. You are accused of making sexually suggestive remarks to Angela that made her feel uncomfortable. Solution: Angela, you are to make sexually suggestive remarks to Kevin that will make him uncomfortable.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I accept your decision!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey... you know what, Dwight? Maybe we should get our photo I.D. taken together.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That doesn't make any sense.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, it saves time, you know. 'Cause we could just meet in the parking lot every morning. Walk in together. Perfect.

Quote.Speaker: Photographer
Quote.Text: [to Dwight, who is sitting in front of the camera] Smile.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I never smile if I can help it. Showing one's teeth is a submission signal in primates. When someone smiles at me, all I see is a chimpanzee begging for its life.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: This came out really well. [picks up Dwight's I.D. from the laminating machine and hands it to Dwight] There you go.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: This is humongous. I am not a security threat...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: And my middle name is 'Kurt', not 'Fart'.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What did I write?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I have another complaint for Jim's permanent file.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Talk to Michael. I gave him the box.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What box?!

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: But I didn't report your snoring-

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Wednesdays, tearful. Tuesdays... [Dwight walks in and rummages through his complaint box]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh. Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ah... agh... dgh... Ahh! No, no! Four years of malfeasance unreported. This cannot stand.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay! Calm down.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No! You calm down! Who's side is Toby on? Who's side are you on?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, hey!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Him or me?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Stop.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Him or me? I cannot work with Jim anymore.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Either he goes, or I go.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dwight...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You choose!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Stop...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: One of us is out of here by the end of today! [runs out]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh... kay...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I am not bluffing!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Do the right thing here, Michael. Okay, I have served you loyally for years.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I deserve this. You know I do!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [picks up Dwight's I.D. and snickers] You know your I.D. says you're a security threat?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You have till five.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, look, Jim. There's a sales manager position open in Stamford. Want me to call Jan and tell her you're interested? I could put in a good word for you, 'cause I'll still be working here. Transfer! Transfer! Everybody! Transfer! Transfer! Transfer! Transfer!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay... you two, in the conference room with me. Nobody leaves until we work this out. Cage match!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Cage matches? Yeah, they work. How could they not work? If they didn't work, everybody would still be in the cage.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, so Dwight, in your own words - [reads from complaint paper] "Someone replaced all my pens and pencils with crayons. I suspect Jim Halpert." [flips to another paper] "Everyone has called me 'Dwayne' all day. I think Jim Halpert paid them to."

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [laughs] Yes! Five bucks each. And it was totally worth it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [reading] "This morning, I found a bloody glove in my desk drawer and Jim Halpert tried to convince me I committed murder. I think he may be the real murderer." [flips to another paper] "Jim Halpert said there was an abandoned infant in the woman's room. When I went to save the child, I saw Meredith on the can." Gah. "This morning, I knocked myself in the head with the phone."

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That actually took a while. I had to put, uh, more and more nickels into his handset, till he got used to the weight, and then I just... took 'em all out.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [reading] "Every time I typed my name, it said 'Diapers'."

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Just a simple macro. You know, these actually don't sound that funny one after another. But he does deserve it, though.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: "By the end of the day, my desk was about two feet closer to the copier."

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, I just moved it an inch every time he went to the bathroom. And that's how I spent my entire day that day.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: The Japanese have this thing called shiatsu massage, where they dig into your body, very hard. And it is very painful. And apparently, some people throw up. But the next day they feel great. I've never had one. They sound awful.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Maybe Stanford would be cool.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's a good market. Higher volume.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah. Maybe we should both go.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I have a girlfriend...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Sure you do, Dwight. Sure.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, there's like, 300 more of these. Let's get to them later.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: So, you going to transfer Jim or not?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Maybe, I haven't decided yet. Let's get to work.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I want an answer by tomorrow.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. Oh... actually, tomorrow's not good. How about later in the week?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Fine.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Good. Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey! Wait. How about a group picture while you're here?

Quote.Speaker: Photographer
Quote.Text: I can't. I only get reimbursed for the I.D. photos.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well... that's... what, a computer camera, right?

Quote.Speaker: Photographer
Quote.Text: You mean digital?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It'll take like two seconds.

Quote.Speaker: Photographer
Quote.Text: 20 bucks.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ugh... All right. Everybody, [looks around at the employees] come on. Group photo for the newsletter.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: You gotta be kiddin' me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Come on, everybody.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Come on, let's go. Creed, Kevin, Oscar... andale! Let's go.

Quote.Speaker: Photographer
Quote.Text: One, two, three... smile. [camera flashes, but no one smiles] Try to smile.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We resolved a lot today, everybody. Think happy thoughts.

Quote.Speaker: Photographer
Quote.Text: Alright, I'm just gonna take it on three... whether you smile or not. One, two, three. [camera flashes]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Good, let's check that out. [looks at preview screen] Ew, okay, all right. One more. We'll take one more.

Quote.Speaker: Photographer
Quote.Text: That'll be another 20.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Angela, I want to talk to you about something.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [off camera] You just press the button.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [looks at to Jim] I am. [looks at Angela] It's about the Save The Date.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Pam, it wasn't her.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What?!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm the one who complained about you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I... I didn't know that Toby was gonna write it down. [the camera flashes] I was just venting.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [off camera] Okay, good. Check that out.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You know, it was one day.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [off camera] That's terrible.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: And I took it right back. It was like...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Oh, dear.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [off camera] Let's pay Mr. Price Gouger. [rejoins the group, on camera] Okay... we can do this. Come on, everybody. All right. Here we go. [flash goes off before he sits down]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It was really hard getting a good picture of fifteen people. He would not give me a good discount. And eight tries added up.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [flashback the photo being taken] One, two..[flash goes off] Didn't say three, did I?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: But, I'm sort of an expert at Photoshop, so it turned out fine in the end. When people work together, there is going to be conflict. You can't outrun your problems.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [on Pam's answering machine] Hey, Pam... it's Jim. Um, I have a doctor's appointment in the city. So I probably won't be in till the late afternoon. Just thought I'd let you know. Okay, bye. [camera shows Jim sitting on a waiting coach in another Dunder Mifflin office]

Quote.Speaker: Female worker
Quote.Text: Okay, Jan will see you now.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And that is why the idea of a cage match is so universally appealing. But here's the thing about cage matches: sometimes you have to open the cage. And that is something Toby will never understand.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [elevator bell dings] What is this? What happened here?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I don't know.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, this does not look good. Did anyone see what happened around my desk area this morning?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Dwight, I really think someone's probably just playing a prank on you, so just go right through it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: A prank, huh? This is official police line tape, okay? It's not a prank.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Probably is.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Damn it, people! Someone must have seen something! [Jim's cell phone beeping] Oh, you people are useless. Jesus.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [telephone ringing] Dunder Mifflin. This is Pam. Hold, please. Dwight, it's the Sheriff. He said that it's really important. It's regarding your desk. I'll transfer.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, no, no, don't! I can't... [groans] [telephone ringing]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Just cut through it, man, it's no big deal.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: This is why I'm a Volunteer Sheriff's Deputy and you're not.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That is not why. Wow, man, he really wants to get in touch with you. Maybe it's a murder.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, there's no blood.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Maybe poison?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Possibly.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: My God!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [exclaiming in fear] No, Jim, no! [Jim knocks Dwight's phone off its cradle] [yelling toward the phone] Sheriff, this is Volunteer Sheriff's Deputy Dwight Schrute. Press the pound key! What's your 20?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Nothing much is happening today. We are having our photo IDs taken. Whoop-de-doo. Can't always be like The Apprentice.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I know.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: On Big Brother, something important happens every day. But real life is not like that.

Quote.Speaker: Photographer
Quote.Text: [Dwight slurping] Okay, here we go. One, two...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: He sometimes wears glasses, write that down. Also, that may not be his real hair.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I hate it when people don't tell each other why they're angry. My dad was like that. I would say, "What's wrong, Dad? What's wrong, Dad? What's wrong, Dad? What's wrong, Dad? What's wrong, Dad? What's wrong, Dad?" Over and over and over. And he would just look at me like I was an idiot.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm the one who petitioned the office board to have these ID badges taken.

Quote.Speaker: Photographer
Quote.Text: So there were no death threats?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Let me see your ID.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: There is this old story about two women who each think they are the mother of this baby. And they can't decide, so they bring the baby to a wise man. Just like a manager in those days. And the wise man says, "I will adopt this baby and raise it as a Hindu." See? They didn't expect that. And that fixed it. Because I think he was the dad anyway.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: There are dozens of old complaints in here. Cold cases, like the show. [imitating gonging] And Toby is a lazy detective who has decided that these armed robberies and rapes and murder/suicides are not important enough to solve. Well, you know what? I have a problem with that. And I'm going to open up these cases before Toby can kill or rape another person.

Quote.Speaker: Photographer
Quote.Text: All right.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: That's not bad. Hey, do you do weddings?

Quote.Speaker: Photographer
Quote.Text: Would you seriously want your wedding photos to look like that?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Not bad.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I gave her a higher clearance than you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What does Level Red mean?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'd tell you, but then I'd have to kill you. [laughing maniacally]

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Wait. [puts eye drops in] [Photographer takes the shot and her eyes are closed]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: No, wait. [put on a hat] Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: You must have misdialed. This is Phyllis. No, I'm not sure what his extension is. [glares at Stanley as he glares right back]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wow! I never thought Dwight would go postal. It's always the person you least expect and I always thought Dwight would go postal.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Come on, Dwight, I think it's actually healthy to get it off your chest.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm done talking. I am a Schrute. We don't back down.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: You're arrogant and pompous, and I don't like you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: "Cage Match"? I don't know if it was in the packet from corporate, because I barely read any of it. So if you're asking if I stole their idea, the answer is no.

Quote.Speaker: Hank the Security Guard
Quote.Text: Excuse me, sir! Dwight Schrute, is that your real name?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes, sir.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Morning.

Quote.Speaker: Hank the Security Guard
Quote.Text: Good morning. Okay, go ahead.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Thank you. [elevator door closes] No, come on... God!
